question.text: Select the WRONG statement regarding carbon cycle.

options.text: Oceanic water can retain upto 50 times the  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  levels in the air.
The only major reservoir of carbon in the biosphere is the lake.
Volcanic eruptions, hotsprings, burning of fossil fuel and weathering add carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.
The recycling of carbon is a self regulating feedback system.

solution.text: The carbon cycle is a gaseous cycle and in the atmosphere carbon dioxide is 29 percent. In the ocean,71 percent carbon dioxide is present in dissolved form. The carbon reservoir is lithosphere so their circulation is self-regulating but recently carbon cycling is getting disturbed due to the combustion of fossil fuels and rapid deforestation. So the correct option is D.
